Class NetworkStreamReader

extends java.lang.Object

      • NetworkStreamReader

        public NetworkStreamReader(java.io.InputStream in,
                   int maxLineLength,
                   java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Creates a new NetworkStreamReader.
        Parameters:
        in - an input network stream
        maxLineLength - a maximum length of the line (in bytes)
        charset - a charset which will be used to convert bytes to strings

    • Method Detail

      • readLine

        public java.lang.String readLine()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads until the first occurrence of CR, LF or CRLF sequence. The line terminator is not contained in returned string. NOTE: If the line is longer than the maximum line length, only first maximum line length bytes are used.
        Returns:
        a line from the input or null, if the end of stream has been reached
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an exception thrown by the underlaying stream

      • read

        public int read()
         throws java.io.IOException
        Call read() on the underlaying stream.
        Returns:
        a byte from the stream or -1 if the EOF has been reached
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an exception thrown by the underlaying stream

      • read

        public int read(byte[] bytes)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Call read(byte[]) on the underlaying stream.
        Parameters:
        bytes - a buffer to be filled
        Returns:
        a number of bytes read from the stream or -1 if the EOF has been reached
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an exception thrown by the underlaying stream

      • read

        public int read(byte[] bytes,
       int offset,
       int length)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Call read(byte[], int, int) on the underlaying stream.
        Parameters:
        bytes - a buffer to be filled
        offset - an offset from the begining in the given buffer
        length - a maximum number of bytes to be read
        Returns:
        a number of bytes read from the stream or -1 if the EOF has been reached
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an exception thrown by the underlaying stream
